definitions.definition: To reach (a conclusion ) by applying rules of logic or other forms of reasoning to given premises or known facts .
To examine , explain , or record (something) in an orderly manner .
To obtain (something) from some source ; to derive .
To be derived or obtained from some source.
To take away (something); to deduct , to subtract (something).
examples: to deduce a part from the whole

labels: based on the word’s Latin etymon
definitions.label_groups: transitive , obsolete , based on the word’s Latin etymon

main_definition: ( transitive ) To reach (a conclusion ) by applying rules of logic or other forms of reasoning to given premises or known facts .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , uncommon ) To examine , explain , or record (something) in an orderly manner .
( transitive , archaic ) To obtain (something) from some source ; to derive .
( intransitive , archaic ) To be derived or obtained from some source.
( transitive , obsolete ) To take away (something); to deduct , to subtract (something).
( transitive , obsolete , based on the word’s Latin etymon ) To lead (something) forth .
